intro: Lysimachia linguiensis, commonly known as the Chinese yellow violet, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, hairy stems and produces clusters of bright yellow blooms in early summer. Lysimachia linguiensis is often used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
